width=40% Block comment: ¢ BlockComment ¢ comment BlockComment comment co BlockComment co # BlockComment # £ BlockComment £

width=30% In-line comment: ; InlineComment   one example (most assembly languages use line comments only)

width=30% Language: AWK, Bash, Maple, R, Tcl, and Windows PowerShell
C (K ;R, ANSI/C89/C90), CHILL, PL/I, and REXX

width=40% Block comment: /* BlockComment *//** Documentation BlockComment */ (ddoc comments) /+ BlockComment +/ (nestable)/++ Documentation BlockComment +/ (nestable, ddoc comments)
( BlockComment ) (single line as well as multiline) ( before -- after ) stack comment convention
%{BlockComment (nestable)%}Note: Both percent–bracket symbols must be the only non-whitespace characters on their respective lines.
=beginBlockComment=cut (=end in Ruby) (POD documentation comment) __END__Comments after end of code
BlockComment """ BlockComment """ (Documentation string when first line of module, class, method, or function)
#`{BlockComment} =comment    This comment paragraph goes until the next POD directive    or the first blank line.

width=30% In-line comment: // InlineComment /// InlineComment  ("Outer" rustdoc comment) //! InlineComment  ("Inner" rustdoc comment)
width=40% Block comment: /* BlockComment */  (nestable) /** BlockComment */  ("Outer" rustdoc comment) /*! BlockComment */  ("Inner" rustdoc comment)
